title: Creating Medium Content
html:

Creating Medium Content

Noemi McElearney
Apr 13

Creating content on here is difficult and I find creating content for my website to be easier.

Posting daily on Medium.

I’ve been posting on Medium daily now. I have seen this piece of advice to write daily so often throughout Medium articles. At first, I had so much to write about. I loved having a place to write whatever comes to mind and getting out all of my emotions, it was sort of like therapy to me. It STILL IS like therapy to me. As time has gone by I’ve realized it’s becoming more and more difficult for me to write on Medium.

Medium is a great place to read. The articles that are most successful in my opinion (tons of claps and followers) are super personal or very informative (as if an expert is writing it).

I am not an expert in much though I do consider myself a good mother and wife. I also consider myself a fairly new blogger.

I’m not sure if I am too comfortable sharing so much of my personal life and my emotions. Why? I feel like keeping some stuff to myself. Other times, I feel like telling the world! I like that I can pick and choose.

It is difficult for me to create content on Medium.

Here’s why:

I don’t know what my audience wants to read. My website audience is very specific. Mostly there are stay at home moms there or bloggers. That’s my main audience. We relate to each other and I’ve made friends there. However, Medium is harder. I have spoken to some writers on here, but not a lot.

Creating content is difficult and sometimes I don’t want to type whatever comes to mind. Since I have my website people I know may also read what I post here, if that makes any sense. I want to make sure I post great pieces but also close to my niche.

Even though it’s difficult for me to post on Medium, I enjoy the outlet. I enjoy the option of being able to get something out here I wouldn’t normally post on my website. I’d rather my rants be posted here than there. Mostly because I don’t want to create pins about rants (laughing to myself). Most of all, I enjoy reading what others write.

Creating content for my website feels like a breeze.

The other day I was creating my content calendar for the entire month of May. I was surprised I had extra posts for the month of June. Where are all these ideas coming from?! I post twice a week so typically that’s 8 posts a month.

Now I know what my readers want to read.

We’re moms. We want marriage posts, cleaning tips, parenting advice, empathy and sympathy. It’s so easy to write because I feel exactly the same. When I am looking to subscribe anywhere, it had better be an awesome website I want to keep coming back to! I end up wanting to know more about the author’s life and I go back to their social media pages for inspiration.

I love to read personal stories on Medium. Sometimes I will even come back and re-read them, which isn’t often. Honestly I re-read more blog posts than Medium posts. Some blog posts are too good to not re-read. There’s a personal voice there and a certain niche. I find this more appealing.

More thoughts.

I hope after a few more months writing here on Medium the content will come to me like it does with my website. I have many doubts though. Any other writers feel this way? If so, please let me know what you do in situations like this. It could possibly help me the same way it has helped you.

  • Medium
  • Writing
  • Writing Life
  • Blogger
  • Creative Process

  • Noemi McElearney

    Medium member since Jan 2019

    Wife, mother, blogger. Believer. www.mrsplanahead.com

  • The Writing Cooperative

    Helping each other write better.
